        public int getMinSymbol()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordStrength
        Return the minimum quantity of symbols required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of symbols supported: space, !, ", #, $, %, &, ', (, ), *, +, comma, -, ., /, :, ;, <, =, >, @, [, \, ], ^, _, {, |, }, ~, ¡, §, ©, «, ¬, ® , ±, µ, ¶, ·, », ½, ¿, ×, ÷.

        public int getMinDiacritic()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordStrength
        Return the minimum quantity of diacritic characters required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of diacritic characters supported: À, Á, Â, Ã, Ä, Å, Æ, Ç, È, É, Ê, Ë, Ì, Í, Î, Ï, Ð, Ñ, Ò, Ó, Ô, Õ, Ö, Ø, Ù, Ú, Û, Ü, Ý, Þ, ß, à, á, â, ã, ä, å, æ, ç, è, é, ê, ë, ì, í, î, ï, ð, ñ, ò, ó, ô, õ, ö, ø, ù, ú, û, ü, ý, þ, ÿ.

      • getPreventReuse

        public int getPreventReuse()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordStrength
        Returns the size of the history of passwords that cannot be reused by Accounts belonging to the associated Directory.
        Specified by:
        getPreventReuse in interface PasswordStrength

        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setPreventReuse

        public PasswordStrength setPreventReuse(int preventReuse)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordStrength
        Specifies the quantity of the previously used passwords (i.e history) that will not be allowed to be reused when modifying the password for an Account belonging to the associated Directory.

        For example, let's assume the following passwords have been previously used in an `Account`: `{'P@ssword123', 'Bar456$', 'Joe789&'}` (where `P@ssword123` is oldest and `Joe789&` is current}. If the `preventReuse` is set to `2` then the user will not be able to change his password to either `Bar456$` or `Joe789&`. He will be allowed to re-use `P@ssword123` though.

        Specified by:
        setPreventReuse in interface PasswordStrength
        Parameters:
        preventReuse - any number between 1 and 25 will set the size of the old passwords that cannot be re-used. 0 disables this configuration, meaning that reusing the current password is allowed.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.1.0
